repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
This isn't very clear. First client according to what ordering?

Either way, a better phrasing might be: "Defaults to the encoding used by the first client in the buffer"
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2179,12 +2179,15 @@ stylize_markdown({bufnr}, {contents}, {opts})
     Return: ~
         (`table`) stripped content
 
-symbols_to_items({symbols}, {bufnr})         *vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*
+                                             *vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*
+symbols_to_items({symbols}, {bufnr}, {offset_encoding})
     Converts symbols to quickfix list items.
 
     Parameters: ~
-      • {symbols}  (`lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]`)
-      • {bufnr}    (`integer?`)
+      • {symbols}          (`lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]`)
+      • {bufnr}            (`integer?`)
+      • {offset_encoding}  (`'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'?`) default to first

@@ -214,7 +216,8 @@ LSP
 
 • Completion side effects (including snippet expansion, execution of commands
   and application of additional text edits) is now built-in.
-• |vim.lsp.util.locations_to_items()| sets `end_col` and `end_lnum` fields.
+• |vim.lsp.util.locations_to_items()| and |vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()| sets

comment_data.body: If `clients` is empty an early return feels cleaner than setting `offset_encoding` to `utf-16`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1757,37 +1757,56 @@ end
 ---
 ---@param symbols lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]
 ---@param bufnr? integer
+---@param offset_encoding? 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
+---                         default to first client of buffer
 ---@return vim.quickfix.entry[] # See |setqflist()| for the format
-function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr)
+function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr, offset_encoding)
   bufnr = bufnr or 0
+  if offset_encoding == nil then
+    vim.notify_once(
+      'symbols_to_items must be called with valid offset encoding',
+      vim.log.levels.WARN
+    )
+    local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr })

comment_data.body: This is to correspond with the previous `locations_to_items`. Should I synchronize the documentation of these two functions?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2179,12 +2179,15 @@ stylize_markdown({bufnr}, {contents}, {opts})
     Return: ~
         (`table`) stripped content
 
-symbols_to_items({symbols}, {bufnr})         *vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*
+                                             *vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*
+symbols_to_items({symbols}, {bufnr}, {offset_encoding})
     Converts symbols to quickfix list items.
 
     Parameters: ~
-      • {symbols}  (`lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]`)
-      • {bufnr}    (`integer?`)
+      • {symbols}          (`lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]`)
+      • {bufnr}            (`integer?`)
+      • {offset_encoding}  (`'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'?`) default to first

comment_data.body:
I see. @lewis6991 I noticed that you last modified this description in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/cbc82011ce19e308f249e1e3ba16f7b1219c9984. Are you okay with using the description from `character_offset`?
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/359763307546ae7a401e9458fefeb6f4cd37a40f/runtime/doc/lsp.txt#L1905-L1906
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2179,12 +2179,15 @@ stylize_markdown({bufnr}, {contents}, {opts})
     Return: ~
         (`table`) stripped content
 
-symbols_to_items({symbols}, {bufnr})         *vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*
+                                             *vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*
+symbols_to_items({symbols}, {bufnr}, {offset_encoding})
     Converts symbols to quickfix list items.
 
     Parameters: ~
-      • {symbols}  (`lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]`)
-      • {bufnr}    (`integer?`)
+      • {symbols}          (`lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]`)
+      • {bufnr}            (`integer?`)
+      • {offset_encoding}  (`'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'?`) default to first

comment_data.body: In the previous API, this function could only pass `symbols`, and I am concerned that some people might use it solely to convert `symbols` (although in nvim's code, it is only used for `vim.lsp.buf.document_symbol`).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1757,37 +1757,56 @@ end
 ---
 ---@param symbols lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]
 ---@param bufnr? integer
+---@param offset_encoding? 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
+---                         default to first client of buffer
 ---@return vim.quickfix.entry[] # See |setqflist()| for the format
-function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr)
+function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr, offset_encoding)
   bufnr = bufnr or 0
+  if offset_encoding == nil then
+    vim.notify_once(
+      'symbols_to_items must be called with valid offset encoding',
+      vim.log.levels.WARN
+    )
+    local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr })

comment_data.body: Hmmm. That feels strange. But if we decide to support this use, I think we should mention that `offset_encoding` will be `utf-16` if there are no clients in the buffer.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1757,37 +1757,56 @@ end
 ---
 ---@param symbols lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]
 ---@param bufnr? integer
+---@param offset_encoding? 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
+---                         default to first client of buffer
 ---@return vim.quickfix.entry[] # See |setqflist()| for the format
-function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr)
+function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr, offset_encoding)
   bufnr = bufnr or 0
+  if offset_encoding == nil then
+    vim.notify_once(
+      'symbols_to_items must be called with valid offset encoding',
+      vim.log.levels.WARN
+    )
+    local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr })

comment_data.body: I thought about it again, and I think we should remove the description of this default value from the documentation and mark it as required, because it triggers a warning, and this usage is deprecated, just like https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31249. `locations_to_items` is the same.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1757,37 +1757,56 @@ end
 ---
 ---@param symbols lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]
 ---@param bufnr? integer
+---@param offset_encoding? 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
+---                         default to first client of buffer
 ---@return vim.quickfix.entry[] # See |setqflist()| for the format
-function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr)
+function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr, offset_encoding)
   bufnr = bufnr or 0
+  if offset_encoding == nil then
+    vim.notify_once(
+      'symbols_to_items must be called with valid offset encoding',
+      vim.log.levels.WARN
+    )
+    local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr })

comment_data.body: Why did the order change here? I think `*vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*` should still be aligned to the right.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,8 @@ LSP
 • |vim.lsp.util.make_position_params()|, |vim.lsp.util.make_range_params()|
   and |vim.lsp.util.make_given_range_params()| now require the `position_encoding`
   parameter.
+• |vim.lsp.util.location_to_items| and |vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()| now
+  requires the `position_encoding` parameter.

comment_data.body: From the implementation it seems like `bufnr` is optional.

comment_data.body: I would use the newly added `vim._resolve_bufnr` here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31499
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1774,37 +1774,55 @@ end
 ---
 ---@param symbols lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]
 ---@param bufnr? integer
+---@param position_encoding 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
 ---@return vim.quickfix.entry[] # See |setqflist()| for the format
-function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr)
+function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr, position_encoding)
   bufnr = bufnr or 0

comment_data.body: I think we haven't resolved this yet. If `clients` is empty here it seems like a misuse of this function?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1757,37 +1757,56 @@ end
 ---
 ---@param symbols lsp.DocumentSymbol[]|lsp.SymbolInformation[]
 ---@param bufnr? integer
+---@param offset_encoding? 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
+---                         default to first client of buffer
 ---@return vim.quickfix.entry[] # See |setqflist()| for the format
-function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr)
+function M.symbols_to_items(symbols, bufnr, offset_encoding)
   bufnr = bufnr or 0
+  if offset_encoding == nil then
+    vim.notify_once(
+      'symbols_to_items must be called with valid offset encoding',
+      vim.log.levels.WARN
+    )
+    local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = bufnr })

comment_data.body: This is because the parameters it adds make the signature too long to fit on one line. `*vim.lsp.util.symbols_to_items()*` is still right-aligned, it just happens to be on a separate line now.

comment_regular_data.body:
Previously, there was no handling of `offset_encoding`. I've fixed it in this PR but that would be a breaking change.

I believe both call hierarchy and type hierarchy have similar issues and this may be worth refactoring. In follow-ups?
It looks like the previously broken CI tests have been fixed. I have resolved the conflicts in this PR, @mfussenegger could you please review it?
Thank you for your review. I just noticed that this PR is still open, but it's a bit old, so I will check again to see if it meets the current requirements.
I've revisited this PR and pushed the rebased changes.
Sorry, it seems I got confused during the rebase. This PR has been around for a while, and I will reimplement it.
Sorry I was offline for a few months. I have revisited this PR, and it is now ready to be reviewed again.
